shortdesc.ph: Occurs when the user role or the audience latency level changes.

p.codeblock: public void onClientRoleChanged(int oldRole, int newRole, ClientRoleOptions newRoleOptions) {}
DECLARE_DYNAMIC_MULTICAST_DELEGATE_ThreeParams(FOnClientRoleChanged, ECLIENT_ROLE_TYPE, oldRole, ECLIENT_ROLE_TYPE, newRole, FClientRoleOptions, roleoption);
public virtual void OnClientRoleChanged(RtcConnection connection, CLIENT_ROLE_TYPE oldRole, CLIENT_ROLE_TYPE newRole, ClientRoleOptions newRoleOptions) { }
final void Function( RtcConnection connection, ClientRoleType oldRole, ClientRoleType newRole, ClientRoleOptions newRoleOptions)? onClientRoleChanged;

section.title: Trigger timing
section.p:
This callback will be triggered in any of the following situations:
Calling or to set the user role or audience latency level after joining a channel
Calling or and set the user role to AUDIENCE before joining a channel.

This callback will be triggered in any of the following situations:
Calling to set the user role or audience latency level after joining a channel.
Calling to set the user role to AUDIENCE before joining a channel.

section.title: Restrictions
section.p: This callback will not be triggered when you call or and set the user role to BROADCASTER before joining a channel.

plentry.pd: Role that the user switches from: .
Role that the user switches to: .

pd.p: Properties of the role that the user switches to. See .
